name: 1,3-Diphenylpropane-1,3-dione
Reason: 1,3-Diphenylpropane-1,3-dione has a melting point that is influenced by several structural components. The basic unit for comparison can be benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The introduction of two phenyl groups increases the molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, with an approximate increase of +20°C per group, totaling +40°C. The dione functional group introduces a carbonyl group, which raises the melting point due to the potential for hydrogen bonding and dipole-dipole interactions, estimated at around +10°C. The methyl group introduces a bulky side chain, reducing the symmetry and increasing the molecular volume, estimated at around +5°C.
